page.title: 05Dairy Farming. Kingsbury.
page.content: Today we visited a farm of 61 acres which has a herd of 42 Friesian milking cows.First of all we saw how the cows were milked.We put our thumbs into the clusters.It felt as if you had put your hand on the end of a vacuum cleaner,except that it did not suck as hard.Then the farmer showed us the pipes that carried the milk to the place where it is kept until the milk- tanker arrives.The place where it is kept is a big rectangular tank.The milk is chilled and then kept cool by refridgeration.The tank holds 878 litres,and is usually about three quarters full after milking.This does not vary much as there is all year round calving.We were there when the milk tanker came.The driver used a metal rod to measure the depth of milk,before he piped it out into his tanker.
